text: farmers working the fields in China's
northern who have a province are used to
a hard life but is not one they want for
their families so they send their
children to rural boarding schools like
this one and who obeys our Leoben
village and was known as one of the best
in the area that was before this teacher
Li Jian was convicted of confining
students inside his home their teenage
boys were bound and gagged tortured and
raped this went on for years
our son knows to cry and they fused to
return to school at first we do not
understand why husband became so angry
but now we know this couples then 16
year old son was the first to break the
silence fashion to Hong Kong to halt the
situation was getting worse so I told my
parents but the memories still haunt the
teacher Li Jian was sentenced to two
years and ten months in prison he
admitted to sexually assaulting his
students but China has no laws banning
male rape over the age of fourteen so in
court
li jian was only found guilty of
detaining the boys his victims want a
harsher punishment so we've just
finished interviewing the family and
it's hard not to be affected by the
intense sadness felt by every member of
this household to see how the actions of
one person can hurt so many but these
parents are also very angry they feel
let down by the system or the lack of a
system in place to protect their son we
visited the police station where the
family first reported the crime the
police officer said
that creep is doing it again so they
knew about this before but didn't do
anything to stop it
the police ignored repeated interview
requests and school officials refused to
answer similar allegations they also
turned a blind eye to the abuse
advocates from Save the Children warned
there's a high risk of abuse at Chinese
boarding schools without proper
safeguards in place 30 million children
in China attends such schools far away
from home schools with no teacher
background checks or means to report
sexual or physical violence
China's Education Ministry is working to
change that
but that's no consolation to some this
family is moving away with their son to
start a new life tired of a system that
didn't keep their child safe and can't
deliver justice now Celia Hatton BBC
news in our Leoben village Hubei
Province
